Title: Grid Services by Behind-the-Meter Distributed Energy Resources: NY State Grid Case Study
Authors: H. Hooshyar, Rahul Kadavil, Victor Paduani, A. Haddadi, A. Jakaria, A. Huque, George Stefopoulos
Venue: IEEE Power & Energy Society General Meeting
Abstract summary: This case study demonstrates that behind-the-meter distributed energy resources can provide grid services when controlled by a DER management system.

Title: The Impact of Distributed Energy Resources on Incumbent Utilities: A Case Study of Long Island, New York
Authors: R. Tabors, Hua He, Michael Birk
Venue: Hawaii International Conference on System Sciences
Abstract summary: This paper examines the impact of distributed energy resources (DERs) on incumbent utilities, using a case study of Long Island, New York, but does not address human factors engineering in utility control rooms.

Title: Understanding and applying research results from over 13 case studies integrating DER from EPRI's Smart Grid demonstration initiative
Authors: M. Wakefield, G. Horst, J. Simmins, Jared Green, Brian Green
Abstract summary: The paper provides an overview of case studies from EPRI's Smart Grid Demonstration Initiative, but does not specifically address human factors engineering applied to utility control rooms managing DERs.

Title: A Fully Distributed Hierarchical Control Framework for Coordinated Operation of DERs in Active Distribution Power Networks
Authors: S. Xia, S. Bu, C. Wan, Xi Lu, K. Chan, Bin Zhou
Abstract summary: This paper proposes a fully distributed hierarchical framework to economically manage multiple distributed energy resources in active distribution power networks.

Title: Control of distributed energy resources for reactive power support
Authors: Brett Robbins, A. Domínguez-García, C. Hadjicostis
Abstract summary: A distributed control algorithm is proposed to utilize DERs for reactive power support and voltage control in power systems.

Title: Integration of Utility Distributed Energy Resource Management System and Aggregators for Evolving Distribution System Operators
Authors: L. Strezoski, H. Padullaparti, F. Ding, M. Baggu
Venue: Journal of Modern Power Systems and Clean Energy
Abstract summary: The paper explores how different DERMS software technologies can complement each other to help distribution system operators manage high penetration of distributed energy resources.

Title: Implementing an Electric Utility Microgrid: Lessons learned
Authors: A. Vukojevic, S. Lukic, L. White
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the implementation of microgrids and the challenges of controlling distributed energy resources (DERs) in electric utility systems.

Title: A Data Driven Approach for Anomaly Detection in Renewable Energy Integrated Power Systems
Authors: Rachita R. Sarangi, Prakash K. Ray, Soumya R. Mohanty, Subir Karmarkar, A. Mohanty
Venue: IEEE Power & Energy Society General Meeting
Abstract summary: This case study presents a data-driven approach using Empirical Mode Decomposition for anomaly detection in distributed energy resource integrated power systems.
